column4: What is the command to change the permissions (owner, group and execute as program) of a file from 'root' to my account ?
just chown and chmod ? Nothing else ?
what else do you need? chown can change group and owner chmod changes execute read and writability of the group user and other
Yes, but no other args ? As in just, $ chown <file> will do it for me ?
Thanks ! And to execute the file as program, giving read/write privileges as well  ?
chmod <user><group><other> <file> <file2>  777 is everyone can do everything
to set on a directory add a -R after chmod so chmod -R 777 / means everyone can do anything on any file (don't do that...it's suicidal)
Yup, I needed that, too ! It's only me... !
the -R works on both commands btw
